ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3 to 4 hours on the lab assignment weekly.
3 hours
4 hours.
2 hours
Homework can be completed during lab period fairly easily if you set your mind to it, with more time needed to study for the midterm and the final project.
10 Hours
about 2-3
7hrs
5 to 6 hours
2-3 hours.
4 hours
1-2 hours depending on the difficulty of the lab.
6Hrs
3 hours
5-10 hours
6-7 hrs per week
1 hour
3-4hrs
5.5 including lab.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Provides some strong background in how to quickly make maps and do basic spatial analysis. The lectures, however, felt kind of useless- everything of value was from the labs.
The labs were very useful. Midterm should be replaced with another lab type assignment instead of an in-class exam.
Learned a lot from the lab session.The lecture is very early in the moring,sometimes it is hard to concentrate this early.
strengths: learn how to use ArcGIS.weaknesses: the course begins at 8:00a.m every Tuesday, it's too early.
GIS is a very helpful software to learn, but this course was not well executed. The labs are too lengthy and the grading and feedback was not helpful.

There was a long delay between submitting assignments and getting feedback such that all the assignments were submitted before we were given much feedback. We were unable, therefore, to apply the corrections from previous assignments in later labs.
Excellent!

I think the course was a good foundation for GIS. I think it would have been helpful to focus a bit more on interpretation of the maps in addition to focusing on how to make them, and also perhaps incorporating some more spatial statistics techniques.My biggest complaint about the course was that the lab assignments were, for the most part, not returned until the end of the course. This was extremely frustrating, as points were taken off in the early labs that could have been corrected in future labs; unfortunately, we could not learn from minor errors as they were not graded in a timely fashion.It also would have been helpful for me to not have the TAs walk through every step of the lab; while I can understand how this is helpful, it is a bit of a crutch.
I really enjoyed doing the final project for this class, and the final presentations. I feel like I have a good basic understanding of GIS.
- The course is a good introduction to GIS and the labs give good practice on using ArcGIS.- The final project was interesting and allowed us to integrate everything we learned.
Very marketable skills.
No comments please.

The lab is really great. My biggest problem is that it was not always clear what the instructors were looking for as answers to the questions on the labs. It was also frustrating that the labs were not returned very quickly so it was hard to judge what I could improve.

-good course, especially the labs-midterm wasn't quite like the practice midterm--a review session in the future may be helpful-may consider having student teams working on the final assess the work of their partner--found work to be very unevenly distributed-lectures didn't need to be 2 hours--maybe 1.5 instead-final project felt rushed--i.e. the help sessions on the same day/day after printing deadline; could have been planned a little more carefully-found book to be unnecessary
very heavy workload
practical, interesting
Lab class is good for learning the software.Class are less related to the skills and how to use the ArcGIS.Lectures starting at 8 am is too early.

The strength of this course was the lab portion of the course. It was very useful to have the labs following what we learned in class and to get hands on experience in using ArcGIS software. The midterm assessment was good but I think it will be more helpful to have a midterm exam that is more practical and project based to give us more experience working with the ArcGIS software before the final project.The final project was a great way to get to know other students in the class and to work together. However, it would have helped if we had a bit of direction and if the TAs were available for extra office hours outside of the assigned lab times.

The obvious strength is the lab component of the course that allows the students to practice the lecture material. The lab assignments were well connected with the lectures although there were a few lectures which could benefit from more comprehensive labs.
Strength: Labs are really helpful and interesting.Weakness: Two hour long class beginning at 8 am does not help the monotonous lectures.

This is a wonderful class in which you learn a very useful skill. The lab sessions and corresponding homework assignments are very helpful and useful as well in re-enforcing the class material. I feel that I have a working understanding of GIS now, a valuable gain. However, I think that knowledge of SAS would have greatly enhanced what I took away from the course. I would make SAS knowledge a pre-equisite.
This is a very useful class. The lectures and lab sessions are combined perfectly. I benefit a lot from this class.
I think it would help to have some extra help with the statistics component.
Strengths include relevant lab assignments and final project.

I consider the skills that I have learned in this course to be crucial to my career in academic medicine and public health. The pace was reasonable, the material was stimulating and the final project/presentation was an important opportunity to practice my skills.A strength of this course was the laboratory sessions, which could have been improved by allowing more time in each session to finish the assigned material. Often times it felt like we were rushing too quickly though the material due to time constraints.

Great at quickly teaching the important parts of a useful public health tool, but the labs can be a little bit too guided and structured at times, providing little room for individual experimentation and exploration.

A good introduction to GIS. Chocked full of useful resources. Various areas designed to develop skills in ARCGIS. Good, albeit not entirely essential, supplementary materials. Course dynamic sometimes made it fun to learn, enjoyable to be challenged to learn.Difficult at times to connect to material; one lecture per week made it somewhat hard to revisit and apply lessons save for those focused on in labs.Midterm practice exam could have more aligned with actual exam.Final project should include peer review option.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Theodore Holford  Tends to ramble; his lectures didn't feel helpful.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Great Prof.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  I think the problem is that the lab session is always one week after the matching lecture,I think it will be easier for us to understand if they can be in the same week, otherwise the TAs have to prepare a lot material before we start our lab session.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  strengths: good arrangement of the lecture and lab.weaknesses: knowledge from lecture was a little be difficult to understand and not explained very clearly.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is a very knowledgeable professor, but I am not sure if lecturing for 2 hours about GIS on a weekly basis is helpful for learning the actual program.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford was a great professor. I thought the material covered was great, and the labs were really useful in learning the concepts.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Excellentï¼
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford did an excellent job of providing a foundation for GIS.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Great and very accommodating to students' needs
Instructor: Theodore Holford  - The instructor gave thorough and interesting lectures with examples of where what we learn in class is being applied in Public Health.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Knows his stuff!
Instructor: Theodore Holford  No comments please. I found Dr. Holford's personality is down to earth.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  conscientious, professional
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Very nice instructor.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford was good at explaining the GIS concepts and providing practical examples where necessary.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford's lecture could benefit greatly if more recent examples were provided in his slides. Some of the examples are outdated and do not reflect the current GIS interface. Although this was not too much of problem, it would still be beneficial to see more precise examples.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Strength: Knows a lot about GISWeakness: Monotonous. Does not explain well to those without average statistics background.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is an expert in the field, and it was an honor to learn with him. His notes and lecture slides were extremely useful to have as resources after class and will be as I work with GIS in the future. The last few lectures were a little dense though, and I am not sure if I took away as much from them.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  He is a very good teacher with a lot of experience. He knows what are the important knowledge for this field. With only a semester of class, he gives the students the skills to accomplish something big.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Instructor was very knowledgeable about course content.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Dr. Holford is thorough, engaging, thoughtful and compassionate. He is a wonderful teacher and an incredible resource for this course. I thoroughly enjoyed learning from him.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  Did a great job of answering even the toughest of questions during lecture. The best way to improve the course would honestly be to change it to a different time slot.

Instructor: Theodore Holford  Clearly knowledgeable. Paced in delivery of material. Approachable. Good humored.Could be more dynamic in presentation.Could find more avenues to encourage interaction in class.
Instructor: Theodore Holford  lectures are not helpful or engaging

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Katherine was awesome. She was really helpful in our labs.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Very good teaching fellow. Organized and helpful. Kept the section on track.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  She is my TA most of the time, and she is really helpful everytime we have questions or problem during lab session, she will pause and answer each, not rush at all.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Neither of the TAs were very helpful. I am not sure if they were given specific instructions to ignore certain email requests, or if they just did not care. I had a technical issue with one of my lab assignments and I was unable to set up a meeting or get an e-mail response from either of them.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  I had both TAs for lab. I felt it would have been more beneficial to have longer labs or shorter lab assignments, because I feel like we were rushed some weeks, which became stressful and meant we got less out of the lab. I appreciated them guiding us through the lab, but also wished lab assignments were posted earlier and graded sooner.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Very knowledgable and helpful.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Overall Kat's instruction was helpful but it would help better if she could speak louder in the lab for clarity.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Super helpful and really knew her GIS. Did a really great job explaining the labs and making sure everyone in lab felt comfortable with the information.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  I had both TAs--Kat and Owais were very very helpful, especially with the final project. Would definitely take another course in which they were TAs. Learned so much and really enjoyed the labs. Very responsive to students.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Katherine was a very helpful TA and she was very patient with us students. She madesure we all had a good understanding of what we were doing in lab. She should keep up the good work.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Katherine was great, always prepared for lab time, and very responsive to our (the students) questions. She was very knowledgeable about the course content and had a wonderful attitude about everything.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Strength: Prepared. Organized. Helpful.Weakness: Can't hear her from the back of the class.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Kat is an awesome TF! She always led lab sessions in an organized, thought-out, and productive manner. She is very accessible and great at answering questions and issues as they arise.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Katherine was great instructor. Really patient and helpful with the assignments. I appreciated her help throughout the semester.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  They both have a lot of knowledge and are both responsible. I learned a lot from them. But it'd be better if they can return the homework a little bit sooner.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  She was wonderful. Extremely helpful and well prepared for labs.
Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  Strengths are the very detailed lab notes and helpfulness in lab sessions. The TAs were very accessible by email and quick to respond to questions.

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  The TA was incredible, simply put. She was accessible, thoughtful and thorough. I met with Katherine on one occasion outside ofclass time to discuss my final project. Incredible job!!

Instructor: Katherine Jane Skene  ... and Owais Gilani (as I had both).BOTH... Very competent. Prepared. Patient. Approachable. Quite helpful without being over-indulgent. Good feedback. Overall.. fantastically fair.Could have had quicker turn around on grading assignments.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  The TAs were very helpful.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  strengths: very patient, very helpful.weaknesses: sometimes a little be hard to understand his accent.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  The TAs for this class were great and really helpful throughout the course. Owais was extremely helpful during lab and made sure everything ran smoothly.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  Excellent and Responsible!
Instructor: Owais Gilani  Owais was great. My only complaint was that the lab assignments were returned very late.

Instructor: Owais Gilani  - Owais was great and very helpful in all the labs.- He is very well informed about ArcGIS and Statistics and is able to answer almost all questions.- He was very good at managing the lab time well and getting through the entire lab within the given time.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  fantastic TA
Instructor: Owais Gilani  Owais is great and made the lab session easy to understand
Instructor: Owais Gilani  conscientious
Instructor: Owais Gilani  good
Instructor: Owais Gilani  TAs are helpful

Instructor: Owais Gilani  Owais and Kat were both very helpful and prompt in responding to questions. I interacted more with Owais as he taught the lab session I was in. He is patient, open to feedback, attentive, very well versed in the material and encouraging.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  Extremely knowledgeable. Very helpful during labs. responds quickly to needs and concerns of students.
Instructor: Owais Gilani  very knowledgeable and willing to help

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: While I'm glad I took the class, it has a lot of seemingly unnecessarily content to get through.
Very useful course for learning GIS. Useful skill to learn.
GIS is a very useful windows-friendly software in public health, for those who are interested in spatial analysis of disease burden, or environmental evaluation, it is recommended to take the course.
I will recommend this course because it's really helpful for YSPH to learn the software ArcGIS, and to apply it into the future research or future study!
No. It is probably better to learn GIS on your own or in the workshops provided on campus.
I think the class is a good introduction to GIS methods and the statistical analysis of spatial data.
Great! Interesting!
Great course for learning the basics of GIS!

- I would definitely recommend this class to another student.- It's a great way to learn and practice GIS and get a sense of how it is applied to Public Health.- Also a great class to gain interest in Spatial Statistics.
Great! Do it!
This course is great in itself and would help public health professionals tremendously in communicating their works through use of spatial maps.
-would definitely recommend the course-interactive labs were the best way to learn GIS and its capabilities
great introduction to GIS however,not always clear what is expected of students in terms of grading lab assignments and what is on the midterm
I would recommend it.
The workload is somewhat heavy.
I would recommend this course to a fellow student
I would recommend it to another student. It is a very thorough introduction of GIS for public health usage, and we learn to use GIS for a number of other applications.
Take it only if acquiring GIS skill is a goal.

I definitely recommend this course to any student. GIS is a critical skill to have in understanding the spatial distribution of disease, and this is the best introductory course to learn to work with it. I would just advise any interested student to gain a working knowledge of SAS first.
Nice introduction to basic GIS concepts. Keep the course files they will help you in the future.
very interesting course
This is a very useful class in the field of Environmental Epidemiology. I definitely will recommend this class.

Although not written, I think some experience with Biostatistics or Statistics is useful for taking this course. It might become a little difficult to follow in the second half - if someone has no experience in statistics.
I would recommend it to students interested in mapping.
This was a course to learn and practice a skill-set with real life applicability for major public health issues.
I would recommend this software to any student who is interested in getting a basic level of understanding of GIS.
An immersive introduction to GIS, specifically ArcGIS. Anyone searching for a visual biostatistical tool, could find this course very helpful.
the class is not great, but GIS is a good skill to have
